body.p: A Canadian study measuring depression level in teens (as reported in the Journal of Adolescence, vol. 25, 2002) randomly sampled 112 male teens and 101 female teens, and scored them on a common depression scale (higher score representing more depression). The researchers suspected that the mean depression score for male teens is higher than for female teens, and wanted to check whether data would support this hypothesis.
The following is the (edited) output for the test:
Which of the following is an appropriate conclusion based on the output?

input.choice: The data provide sufficient evidence to reject H0 and to conclude that the mean depression score for male teens is larger than that of female teens.
The data provide sufficient evidence to conclude that male and female teens do not differ in mean depression score.
The data do not provide sufficient evidence to conclude that the mean depression score of male teens is larger than that of female teens.
The data do not provide sufficient evidence to reject H0, so we accept it, and conclude that male and female teens do not differ in mean depression score.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Notice that the p-value is much larger than 0.05.
Incorrect. Since the p-value is large (0.4), the data do not provide enough evidence to reject the null hypothesis.

Correct. Since the p-value is large (0.4) the data do not provide enough evidence to reject the null hypothesis in favor of the alternative hypothesis (which claims that male teens’ mean depression score is higher).
Incorrect. “Not having enough evidence to reject H0” does not mean that we accept it. We never accept the null hypothesis.

body.p: A study measuring fitness level in teens randomly sampled 112 male teens and 101 female teens with a higher score indicating more fitness. Researchers suspected that the fitness level for male teens (μ1) is higher than for female teens (μ2), and wanted to check whether the data would supported this hypothesis.
t-test of difference: df = 210 t-value = 0.25 p-value = 0.400
Which of the following is an appropriate conclusion based on the output?

input.choice: The data provide sufficient evidence to reject H0 and to conclude that the mean fitness score for male teens is higher than that of female teens.
The data provide sufficient evidence to conclude that male and female teens do not differ in mean fitness score.
The data do not provide sufficient evidence to reject H0, so we accept it, and conclude that female and male teens do not differ in mean fitness score.
The data do not provide sufficient evidence to conclude that the mean fitness score of male teens is higher than that of female teens.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Notice that the p-value is much larger than 0.05.

Incorrect. Since the p-value is large (0.40), the data do not provide enough evidence to reject the null hypothesis. However, you cannot conclude that male and female teens do not differ in mean fitness score.
Incorrect. “Not having enough evidence to reject H0” does not mean that we accept it. We never accept the null hypothesis.
Correct. Since the p-value is large (0.40) the data do not provide enough evidence to reject the null hypothesis.
